66
A WILL DRAWN UP IN COURT WHEN THE TESTATOR DOES NOT KNOW HOW OR IS UNABLE TO READ IT
(1) When a testator does not know how or is unable to read a will drawn up for him or her by a judge, the latter shall read it to the testator in the presence of two witnesses and the testator shall then, after he or she has declared that it is his or her will, sign it or make a mark on it in his or her own hand in the presence of the same witnesses.
(2) The two witnesses shall sign the will.
